column2: Jeff, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I found out about Doan's while Googling and trying to find an OTC muscle relaxant. Unfortunately there are no OTC muscle relaxants in the US, but Doan's kept coming up on message boards as an "alternative" to the standard pain meds on the shelves (Aspirin, Tylenol, Ibuprofen, Naproxen). So I went to the store and bought a 24ct box of Doan's. Come to find out, the Magnesium compound that makes up Doan's is technically a unique NSAID/anti-inflammatory. I thought it was something "different". So anyway, you can't/shouldn't take it if you've already taken Ibuprofen, Naproxen, Aspirin, or any other NSAID. So I took 2 of the Doan's with 2 Tylenol and the edge was definitely taken off my back pain. Not sure how superior it necessarily is to using Ibuprofen/Naproxen/Aspirin in place of the Doan's, but oh well.
